title: Sanji's True Motivation for Wanting the Clear-Clear Fruit

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Involves Sanji's fight with Absalom later in the arc

theoryText: When Sanji learns that Absalom has the Clear-Clear Fruit (Suke Suke no Mi), he becomes furious not just because Nami is in danger, but because Absalom possesses the Devil Fruit that Sanji has always wanted. The theory explores whether Sanji's anger is more about losing the fruit he desired for voyeuristic purposes or genuine concern for Nami's safety. This becomes a point of character analysis and debate about whether Oda intentionally made Sanji's pervert trait too prominent, potentially damaging his character.
evidence: Sanji explicitly states he has always wanted the Clear-Clear Fruit in Episode 341-342 range
Sanji admits he would use the invisibility to spy on women
His anger when fighting Absalom has dual motivations

popularity.note: Widely discussed as a controversial character moment

sources.title: Eiichiro Oda May Have Gone Too Far in Thriller Bark Arc to Ruin Sanji

title: Absalom's Fruit Later Goes to Shiryu - Foreshadowing

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: ULTRA SECRET - Spoils Absalom's death and Shiryu gaining his fruit

theoryText: Some fans theorized after Absalom's introduction that his Clear-Clear Fruit would eventually be taken by the Blackbeard Pirates, as the fruit's power is too valuable to remain with a mid-tier antagonist. This theory was later confirmed when it was revealed that Absalom was killed by the Blackbeard Pirates and his fruit was given to Shiryu. The early introduction of this fruit's power in Episode 341 serves as long-term setup for this eventual power transfer.
evidence: Absalom's fruit is shown to be extremely powerful but underutilized
The Blackbeard Pirates are known to hunt Devil Fruit users
Shiryu later appears with the Clear-Clear Fruit

popularity.note: Theory was confirmed in later chapters/episodes

title: The Absalom-Nami Scene as Commentary on Vulnerability

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Only involves Thriller Bark arc events

theoryText: Some fans have theorized that the controversial bathroom attack scene in Episode 341 was meant to establish serious stakes and demonstrate the genuine danger the crew faces when separated, rather than being played purely for fanservice. The theory suggests Oda intended to show that even powerful crew members like Nami can be vulnerable to unexpected threats, making the crew's later triumph more meaningful. However, critics argue the execution undermined this intent by framing the assault with comedic elements.
evidence: Nami successfully defends herself by kicking Absalom
Usopp and Chopper immediately rush to her defense
The scene leads to genuine character development and motivation for later confrontation
